articles.content:

articles.title: Tiger Woods shoots 77, Xander Schauffele leads after Round 1 of JP McManus Pro-Am
articles.description: Tiger Woods carded a 5-over 77 and sits tied for 43rd at the star-studded JP McManus Pro-Am in Ireland, where Xander Schauffele leads by 3.
articles.content:
Tiger Woods was back playing competitive golf Monday, shooting a 5-over 77 at the star-studded JP McManus Pro-Am at Adare Manor in Limerick, Ireland.
Woods sits in a tie for 43rd in the 50-player fi… [+1690 chars]

articles.title: Chicago White Sox cancel postgame fireworks show after mass shooting at July 4 parade in Highland Park
articles.description: The White Sox canceled their postgame fireworks celebration on Monday in the wake of a mass shooting at an Independence Day parade in suburban Chicago that left at least six people dead and wounded 24 others.

articles.title: Rafael Nadal, Nick Kyrgios advance into Wimbledon men's quarterfinals
articles.description: Rafael Nadal, Nick Kyrgios, Taylor Fitz and Cristian Garin advanced to the Wimbledon quarterfinals with victories Monday.
articles.content:
Everything went smoothly for Rafael Nadal against Botic Van De Zandschulp on Monday until it came time to close out their fourth-round match at Wimbledon.

articles.title: WNBA star Brittney Griner makes direct appeal to President Biden for her freedom, asks in letter to 'please don't forget about me'
articles.description: Brittney Griner, whose trial in Russia began Friday, made a direct appeal to President Biden for her freedom Monday in a letter passed on through her representatives, writing, "I'm terrified I might be here forever."

articles.title: Offensive lineman Francis Mauigoa, No. 5 in the 2023 ESPN 300, next in line to commit to Miami Hurricanes football program
articles.description: Francis Mauigoa, a 6-foot-6, 325-pound offensive lineman and the No. 5 recruit in the 2023 ESPN 300, committed to coach Mario Cristobal and the new-look Miami Hurricanes on Monday.
articles.content:
Offensive lineman Francis Mauigoa pulled a mild surprise by committing to Miami on Monday.

articles.title: Joey 'Jaws' Chestnut, slowed by injury, captures 15th Fourth of July hot dog eating contest title by eating 63 franks and buns
articles.description: Joey "Jaws'' Chestnut gobbled his way to a 15th win Monday at the Fourth of July hot dog eating contest, powering down 63 franks and buns, while Miki Sudo returned to win the women's title by eating 40 wieners at the annual event in Coney Island.

articles.title: ESPN NFL reporter and handicapping expert Hank Goldberg dies at 82
articles.description: Hank Goldberg, who worked at ESPN as an NFL reporter and handicapping expert for two decades, died Monday on his 82nd birthday, his family confirmed.
